intro: Queria, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its bright orange to red flower heads and long, feathery leaves. The plant belongs to the genus Tithonia and is part of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Queria is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
